intro: Brachyotum grisebachii, commonly known as the grey brachyotum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, greyish pubescence. Its showy, tubular flowers are typically arranged in whorls and come in shades of purple or blue. Brachyotum grisebachii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
